Published March 29, 2016 by flagsrus

This Birdhouse Whimsy Welcome flag from Custom Decor features a cute and cartoon-likeÂ blue bird perched on a birdhouse surrounded by purple and pink flowers. We all love birds, don’t we? If so, you should definitely get this flag which also comes in garden and house flag sizes.

This flag kind of reminds you of a coffee shop chalkboard sign on the sidewalk early in the morning. The Wildflower Jar Flag makes you want to make a hot cup of coffee. This flag features a “Home” text on a jar with colorful flowers on a chalkboard background. You can get the garden flag for only $13.11.

If you love flowers and you love anything that’s blue, you’d love this Blue Hydrangeas Flag. This flag is covered with lovely blue Hydrangeas. TheÂ flag speaks for itself and it’s beauty. This design comes in garden and house flag size, doormat and mailbox cover.

This doormat is a cute greeting piece for your guests. It features 3 chickadees perched on a metal fenceÂ on a garden of bright pink flowers. The contrast of the colors makes the design pop and more eye-catchy. You can get this doormat for only $27.92. The design comes in flag and mailbox cover versions.

The Welcome Bluebird Mailbox Cover features a bluebird perched on some daisies in a bright green background. Perfect Spring mailbox cover colors. You can get this mailbox cover for only $16.97.

Spring is just getting started but the heat we are getting for these Spring flags almost makes you feel it’s already Summer! The other thing that makes it hotter is our 10% discount for our Spring products! Just enter the promo code “SPRING10” on your order and you get 10% off on all spring-themed products!

HAPPY SPRING TIME!

Birds sing of spring!

Published March 20, 2016 by Russ Kennedy

 

March 20th marks the official first day of spring and we can hear the lovely chirping of the songÂ birds ushering in the warmer weather. Pictured above is this beautiful songbirds basket flag that will be perfect to welcome guests to your home bird sanctuary. This nestle of birds at the feeder looks so real that you will be listening for the songs as the flag flutters in the breeze.

I myself am excited for the birds to come, my backyard porch light becomes home for a robins nest very spring.

It’s so amazing how the robins build such a perfect little nest and we love to watch and listen as the babies grow and eventually leave the nest.

If song birds sing, do humming birds hum? This might be a question for the experts. However, oneÂ doesn’tÂ have to be an expert to enjoy watching birds and you can watch for your mail as you bird watch with aÂ mailbox wrap. Whether you are out watching birds or getting the mail, leave the springtime mud at the doorway with a decorative doormat.

We have so manyÂ bird flags of different styles, we could fill anÂ Aviary!Â These flags are a perfect backdrop as you sit and relax on a weekend morning listening to the real song birds greet the day. We are excitedÂ to share our love of birds and springtime yard decorations with you.

Happy Spring!

Good day sunshine!

Published March 13, 2016 by Russ Kennedy

For many of us we have just sprung into “Daylight Saving Time” which we are told gives one extra hour to enjoy the sunshine. The first few days can be a bit rough as we areÂ setting our clocks forward so we are upÂ one hourÂ early to enjoy the sunshine and daylight.

For those who may need a little extra sunshine to get them moving, we have a variety of sun flags that will brighten even the most shady spots in your yard or front porch. You can almost feel the warm rays on your face as you sit out under your sunshine flag.Â  With all the increased sunlight, one might feel the need for a pair of sunglasses or at least a flag that looks like a cool pair of shades.

Spring is making it’s way along with the sunshine and we know soon that flowers will be blooming, birds singing and all the fun outdoor activities will beÂ in full swing. Fortunately you don’t have to wait on mother nature to provide the perfect scenery if you have your line up of spring and summer flags at the ready.

 

So get up, get out of bed, drag a comb across your head and start on your sunshine seasonal flags today!

Here Comes the SUN! Spring Flag Voting Contest!

Published March 10, 2016 by flagsrus

“O to go back to the place where I was born!
To hear the birds sing once more!
To ramble about the house and barn, and over the fields, once more,
And through the orchard and along the old lanes once more.”

This excerpt from Walt Whitman’s Poem of Joys reminds me of what springÂ should be. It’s all about enjoying natureÂ andÂ appreciating the cycle of life as the icy realmÂ of winter turnsÂ into a blooming festival of sunshine and colors.

This is probably the biggest reason why we all love putting up our spring flags. Putting up a spring flower flag in one’s garden is happiness in itself.

To celebrate the coming of Spring, we at FlagsRUs, brings you our “Here Comes the Sun” Spring Flag Voting Contest.

Voting Contest

The Spring Flag Voting Contest is simple! You choose your favorite flag from the contestants (flags) and vote for it by entering your email address. Then, at the end of the contest, a lucky winner will be randomly chosen among all the voters. The lucky winner will receive a $50 gift code from FlagsRus.org!

It’s that simple!

So, proceed to our contest page by clicking here or the button bellowÂ and vote for your favorite Spring flag!

HAPPY SPRING! Â

Welcome to the jungle!

Published March 4, 2016 by Russ Kennedy

 

A favorite pastime of many families is a trip to the local zoo for a day of fun and adventure. This gives us the opportunityÂ to see and learn about a variety of animals especially those of the jungle or safari.

This beautiful flag is bursting with colors as it shows off a variety of wild creatures.

 

One of my favorite animals is the giraffe; so graceful in theirÂ movements, gliding along the plains, stopping to munch leaves from the tree tops. To me they are one of the most elegant creatures.We even have a giraffe flag in our collection… think this may have to go up in my yard.

Perhaps you fancy the playful pachyderms; splashing around in watering holes or giving themselves a dust bath to keep cool from theÂ hot sun. They are amazing creatures and if you are a fan of the elephant you could enjoy seeing them year round with an elephant flag for your home.

Kids always want a souvenir from the visit to the zoo and this cute giraffe and elephant flag could make a great surprise for the little adventurer in your family. This would look cool hanging in their bedroom or play area.

Take a trip to the wild kingdom anytime you wish with an animal flag of your own. We might just have as many critters as your local zoo!

Colored eggs, baskets full of candy or a time of reflectionÂ spent atÂ church.

For flag lovers this is another wonderful holiday to display your sentiment for this special time of year with flags and other themed decor. Bunnies, eggs, chic’s oh my, we have a bundle full of cute Easter flags for your home, garden or business.

If you preferÂ the religious aspectÂ of the Easter holiday, we certainly can help you put on a niceÂ display of remembrance whether at your home or even the Easter Sunday celebration at your church. We even have flags resembling the beautiful stained glass windows of the sanctuary or even something like the Amazing Grace flag with the sheep wouldÂ look nice in the children’s Â Sunday school area.

Others may want a nice Easter display that is festive and colorful and maybe a little more realistic with the cut little critters. We have designs that will work for your display as well.

One of my favorite flags is this double sided bunny garden flag, it’s festive and a little bit silly.

We hope that this Easter brings you joy and happiness along with time of peace to all.

Irish for a day.

Published February 14, 2016 by Russ Kennedy

Did I just see a leprechaun?

St. Patrick’s Day is close at hand and as sure as there will be corned beef and cabbage, we will have Irish themed decor for you. Not to be outdone by the Mardi Gras celebration, folks everywhere will be wearing the green and having fun till the sun comes up.

“There’s no corn in my beef!” The term corn does not refer to the grain but ratherÂ the large saltÂ kernels once used to preserve the meat.

Parades:

Parades are a huge part of the days festivities, usually the kick off for the entire day of food, fun, music and merriment.

New York Cityâs Saint Patrickâs Day Parade is one of the worldâs largest parades. Since 1762, 250,000 marchers have traipsed up Fifth Avenue on foot â the parade still doesnât allow floats, cars, or other modern trappings.

Perhaps you are marching in a parade this year or maybe standing by the side lines as a spectator, make sure toÂ have an Irish themed flag to wave and show your part of the fun.

WhyÂ Shamrocks?

How did the shamrock become associated with Saint Patrick? According to Irish legend, the saint used the three-leafed plant as a metaphor for the Holy Trinity when he was first introducing Christianity to Ireland.

Parties:

You can’t throw a blarney stone without hitting some sort of St. Pat’s day party. The Celtic music and laughter will draw you in from the fields and fill you up with fun and frolic. There is no lack of food, dancing and of course beer ad a St. Patrick’s day party. If you are the host make sure to hang a flag at the front door so folks no where to find you.

Pot o’ gold:

Here is a funÂ fact from Irish lore: Leprechauns earned that gold theyâre guarding. According to legend, leprechauns spend their days as shoe cobblers; itâs hard work, so you canât blame them for being territorial about their pots of gold.

Have fun celebrating and be safe, we don’t want you to get thrown in the PaddyÂ wagon.
